title: Another CLI spec file parsing corner-case.

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Spack fails to properly parse a spec.yaml passed on the command line if the path to that file includes certain characters.  I suspect that these problematic characters may include `+` and/or `-`, though there may be others.  In my case, I ran into this problem as part of a spack ci process that was partially customized.  Among these customizations included a process whereby a job's build directory included a component that is made up of a base64-encoded hash.  This wouldn't be as much of an issue for me if not for the fact that `spack ci` runs a `spack install` command internally, and it is this internal invocation that is failing (presumably, because it does not explicitly pass `-f` to disambiguate).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ docker run --rm -it spack/centos7

# from within the container:
$ spack spec --yaml zlib > zlib.yaml
$ mkdir EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI  # example path component
$ ln -s ../zlib.yaml EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml

# OK
$ spack spec ./zlib.yaml
$ spack spec /root/zlib.yaml
$ spack install ./zlib.yaml
$ spack install /root/zlib.yaml

# FAIL - Same exact file, different path
$ spack spec /root/EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml
$ spack spec ./EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml
$ spack install /root/EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml
$ spack install ./EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml
...
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack --debug --stacktrace install /root/EW3t+qT-TTxd1B5CjT+8J0GT8sI/zlib.yaml
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.730107] Imported install from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/config.py:907 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.732803] Reading config file /opt/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.761065] Imported install from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/database.py:362 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.763745] DATABASE LOCK TIMEOUT: 3s
lib/spack/spack/database.py:366 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.764194] PACKAGE LOCK TIMEOUT: No timeout
lib/spack/spack/main.py:765 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.765682] SpackError: No installed spec matches the hash: 'root'
lib/spack/spack/error.py:55 ==> [2020-12-08-16:55:02.765959] Error: No installed spec matches the hash: 'root'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 762, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 490, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 299, in install
    abstract_specs = spack.cmd.parse_specs(args.spec)
  File "/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py", line 181, in parse_specs
    raise spack.error.SpackError(msg)
spack.error.SpackError: No installed spec matches the hash: 'root'
```
